results.title: Intracranial haemodynamics during attenuated responses to electroconvulsive therapy in the presence of an intracerebral aneurysm.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: In a @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Depressive_Disorder_Major</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003865 @@@major depression@@@ and a coexisting @DISEASE_Aneurysm @DISEASE_MESH:D000783 @@@intracerebral saccular aneurysm@@@ who was treated with ECT, the combination of beta blockade with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ and intravenous infusion of @CHEMICAL_Nitroprusside @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009599 @@@sodium nitroprusside@@@ prevented @DISEASE_Tachycardia @DISEASE_MESH:D013610 @@@tachycardia@@@ and @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@, and greatly attenuated the expected increase in flow velocity in the middle cerebral artery.

citations.NLM: Viguera A, Rordorf G, Schouten R, Welch C, Drop LJ. Intracranial haemodynamics during attenuated responses to electroconvulsive therapy in the presence of an intracerebral aneurysm. J Neurol Neurosurg Psychiatry. 1998 Jun;64(6):802-5. PMID: 9647316
